title: The warmest cities in South America
summary: This chart here shows the warmest cities in South America .
\n\\n Starting from the warmest , the Temperature in Bogota was 16 degrees Celsius , while the City was Belem , having reached 36 degrees Celsius .
In between we had Santiago at 20 degrees Celsius , Cordoba at 23 degrees Celsius , Lima at 25 degrees Celsius and Montevideo at 29 degrees Celsius .
gold: This chart shows the warmest cities in South America . \n It demonstrates that Belem is the warmest , with a temperature of 36 C , while Bogota is the coldest , with a temperature of 16 C .
